greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of unitary prime divisors of central binomial coefficient, C(2n,n) = A000984(n), i.e., number of those prime factors in C(2n,n), whose exponent equals one.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..2000
mathematica: Table[Function[m, Count[Divisors@ m, k_ /; And[PrimeQ@ k, GCD[k, m/k] == 1]]]@ Binomial[2 n, n], {n, 50}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Dec 17 2016 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(f=factor(binomial(2*n, n))); sum(k=1, #f~, f[k,2] == 1); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Dec 18 2016
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Mar 27 2003
